channel.title: Pk Zone
channel.description:
x3229-y3430 x3260-y3424 \ \ x3229-y3442 x3260-y3430 ( <- Those 2 i need 2 use? )
Thats between Varrock bank and dummy zone i want that 2 become pk zone how i do that? :confused: ( Bcs in my source varrock is a save zone :| )[br][size=1]Posted on: April 22, 2007, 01:59:20 PM[/size][hr]where ineed 2 add those coords?

item.title: Pk Zone
item.dc:creator: @Greenspirit Greenspirit
item.description:
@Greenspirit wrote:

[quote=“Slyte, post:1, topic:34320”]Purpose: To make a cool PK area or island/zone

Difficulty: 2

Assumed Knowledge: Copy & Paste

Server Base: Testscape

Classes Modified: client.java

Procedure
Step 1:
Open up your client.java and search for

public void checkwildy()

You will see

public void checkwildy() { if ((absY <= 10112 && absY >= 3970) || (absY <= 3672)) { inwildy = false; } else { inwildy = true; } } public void checkwildy2() { if ((absY <= 10112 && absY >= 3970) || (absY <= 3514)) { inwildy2 = false; } else { inwildy2 = true; } }

Replace that whole code with

public void checkwildy() { if((absX >= 2518 && absX <= 2531 && absY >= 4767 && absY <= 4786)) { inwildy = true; } else { inwildy = false; } } public void checkwildy2() { if((absX >= 2518 && absX <= 2531 && absY >= 4767 && absY <= 4786)) { inwildy2 = true; } else { inwildy2 = false; } }

Step 2: Want to know how to make your own pking area?
To make it so you can have your own little pking zone do this:

Stand in the south-west corner of where you want your safe zone to be, and you get the coords, so lets say where your standing it says 1000, 1001 for example. The 1000 is your x coord,and the 1001 is the y coord. So its like this:

if((absX >= 1000 && absX <= xcoord && absY >= 1001 && absY <= ycoord))

Now you go to the North east corner and find those coords, lets say those are 1010, 1011
So now it would be this

if((absX >= 2518 && absX <= 1010 && absY >= 4767 && absY <= 1011))Now you do that to where you want it to be

Credits: Me, unless made before[/quote]

i dont understand it lol

Read full topic
